00041 #include "o2iblnd.h"
00042 
00043 static int service = 987;
00044 module_param(service, int, 0444);
00045 MODULE_PARM_DESC(service, "service number (within RDMA_PS_TCP)");
00046 
00047 static int cksum = 0;
00048 module_param(cksum, int, 0644);
00049 MODULE_PARM_DESC(cksum, "set non-zero to enable message (not RDMA) checksums");
00050 
00051 static int timeout = 50;
00052 module_param(timeout, int, 0644);
00053 MODULE_PARM_DESC(timeout, "timeout (seconds)");
00054 
00055 /* Number of threads in each scheduler pool which is percpt,
00056  * we will estimate reasonable value based on CPUs if it's set to zero. */
00057 static int nscheds;
00058 module_param(nscheds, int, 0444);
00059 MODULE_PARM_DESC(nscheds, "number of threads in each scheduler pool");
00060 
00061 /* NB: this value is shared by all CPTs, it can grow at runtime */
00062 static int ntx = 512;
00063 module_param(ntx, int, 0444);
00064 MODULE_PARM_DESC(ntx, "# of message descriptors allocated for each pool");
00065 
00066 /* NB: this value is shared by all CPTs */
00067 static int credits = 256;
00068 module_param(credits, int, 0444);
00069 MODULE_PARM_DESC(credits, "# concurrent sends");
00070 
00071 static int peer_credits = 8;
00072 module_param(peer_credits, int, 0444);
00073 MODULE_PARM_DESC(peer_credits, "# concurrent sends to 1 peer");
00074 
00075 static int peer_credits_hiw = 0;
00076 module_param(peer_credits_hiw, int, 0444);
00077 MODULE_PARM_DESC(peer_credits_hiw, "when eagerly to return credits");
00078 
00079 static int peer_buffer_credits = 0;
00080 module_param(peer_buffer_credits, int, 0444);
00081 MODULE_PARM_DESC(peer_buffer_credits, "# per-peer router buffer credits");
00082 
00083 static int peer_timeout = 180;
00084 module_param(peer_timeout, int, 0444);
00085 MODULE_PARM_DESC(peer_timeout, "Seconds without aliveness news to declare peer dead (<=0 to disable)");
00086 
00087 static char *ipif_name = "ib0";
00088 module_param(ipif_name, charp, 0444);
00089 MODULE_PARM_DESC(ipif_name, "IPoIB interface name");
00090 
00091 static int retry_count = 5;
00092 module_param(retry_count, int, 0644);
00093 MODULE_PARM_DESC(retry_count, "Retransmissions when no ACK received");
00094 
00095 static int rnr_retry_count = 6;
00096 module_param(rnr_retry_count, int, 0644);
00097 MODULE_PARM_DESC(rnr_retry_count, "RNR retransmissions");
00098 
00099 static int keepalive = 100;
00100 module_param(keepalive, int, 0644);
00101 MODULE_PARM_DESC(keepalive, "Idle time in seconds before sending a keepalive");
00102 
00103 static int ib_mtu;
00104 module_param(ib_mtu, int, 0444);
00105 MODULE_PARM_DESC(ib_mtu, "IB MTU 256/512/1024/2048/4096");
00106 
00107 static int concurrent_sends;
00108 module_param(concurrent_sends, int, 0444);
00109 MODULE_PARM_DESC(concurrent_sends, "send work-queue sizing");
00110 
00111 static int map_on_demand;
00112 module_param(map_on_demand, int, 0444);
00113 MODULE_PARM_DESC(map_on_demand, "map on demand");
00114 
00115 /* NB: this value is shared by all CPTs, it can grow at runtime */
00116 static int fmr_pool_size = 512;
00117 module_param(fmr_pool_size, int, 0444);
00118 MODULE_PARM_DESC(fmr_pool_size, "size of fmr pool on each CPT (>= ntx / 4)");
00119 
00120 /* NB: this value is shared by all CPTs, it can grow at runtime */
00121 static int fmr_flush_trigger = 384;
00122 module_param(fmr_flush_trigger, int, 0444);
00123 MODULE_PARM_DESC(fmr_flush_trigger, "# dirty FMRs that triggers pool flush");
00124 
00125 static int fmr_cache = 1;
00126 module_param(fmr_cache, int, 0444);
00127 MODULE_PARM_DESC(fmr_cache, "non-zero to enable FMR caching");
00128 
00129 /*
00130  * 0: disable failover
00131  * 1: enable failover if necessary
00132  * 2: force to failover (for debug)
00133  */
00134 static int dev_failover = 0;
00135 module_param(dev_failover, int, 0444);
00136 MODULE_PARM_DESC(dev_failover, "HCA failover for bonding (0 off, 1 on, other values reserved)");
00137 
00138 static int require_privileged_port;
00139 module_param(require_privileged_port, int, 0644);
00140 MODULE_PARM_DESC(require_privileged_port, "require privileged port when accepting connection");
00141 
00142 static int use_privileged_port = 1;
00143 module_param(use_privileged_port, int, 0644);
00144 MODULE_PARM_DESC(use_privileged_port, "use privileged port when initiating connection");
00145 
00146 kib_tunables_t kiblnd_tunables = {
00147         .kib_dev_failover           = &dev_failover,
00148         .kib_service                = &service,
00149         .kib_cksum                  = &cksum,
00150         .kib_timeout                = &timeout,
00151         .kib_keepalive              = &keepalive,
00152         .kib_ntx                    = &ntx,
00153         .kib_default_ipif           = &ipif_name,
00154         .kib_retry_count            = &retry_count,
00155         .kib_rnr_retry_count        = &rnr_retry_count,
00156         .kib_ib_mtu                 = &ib_mtu,
00157         .kib_require_priv_port      = &require_privileged_port,
00158         .kib_use_priv_port          = &use_privileged_port,
00159         .kib_nscheds                = &nscheds
00160 };
00161 
00162 static struct lnet_ioctl_config_o2iblnd_tunables default_tunables;
00163 
00164 /* # messages/RDMAs in-flight */
00165 int
00166 kiblnd_msg_queue_size(int version, lnet_ni_t *ni)
00167 {
00168         if (version == IBLND_MSG_VERSION_1)
00169                 return IBLND_MSG_QUEUE_SIZE_V1;
00170         else if (ni)
00171                 return ni->ni_peertxcredits;
00172         else
00173                 return peer_credits;
00174 }
00175 
00176 int
00177 kiblnd_tunables_setup(lnet_ni_t *ni)
00178 {
00179         struct lnet_ioctl_config_o2iblnd_tunables *tunables;
00180 
00181         /*
00182          * if there was no tunables specified, setup the tunables to be
00183          * defaulted
00184          */
00185         if (!ni->ni_lnd_tunables) {
00186                 LIBCFS_ALLOC(ni->ni_lnd_tunables,
00187                              sizeof(*ni->ni_lnd_tunables));
00188                 if (!ni->ni_lnd_tunables)
00189                         return -ENOMEM;
00190 
00191                 memcpy(&ni->ni_lnd_tunables->lt_tun_u.lt_o2ib,
00192                        &default_tunables, sizeof(*tunables));
00193         }
00194         tunables = &ni->ni_lnd_tunables->lt_tun_u.lt_o2ib;
00195 
00196         /* Current API version */
00197         tunables->lnd_version = 0;
00198 
00199         if (kiblnd_translate_mtu(*kiblnd_tunables.kib_ib_mtu) < 0) {
00200                 CERROR("Invalid ib_mtu %d, expected 256/512/1024/2048/4096\n",
00201                        *kiblnd_tunables.kib_ib_mtu);
00202                 return -EINVAL;
00203         }
00204 
00205         if (!ni->ni_peertimeout)
00206                 ni->ni_peertimeout = peer_timeout;
00207 
00208         if (!ni->ni_maxtxcredits)
00209                 ni->ni_maxtxcredits = credits;
00210 
00211         if (!ni->ni_peertxcredits)
00212                 ni->ni_peertxcredits = peer_credits;
00213 
00214         if (!ni->ni_peerrtrcredits)
00215                 ni->ni_peerrtrcredits = peer_buffer_credits;
00216 
00217         if (ni->ni_peertxcredits < IBLND_CREDITS_DEFAULT)
00218                 ni->ni_peertxcredits = IBLND_CREDITS_DEFAULT;
00219 
00220         if (ni->ni_peertxcredits > IBLND_CREDITS_MAX)
00221                 ni->ni_peertxcredits = IBLND_CREDITS_MAX;
00222 
00223         if (ni->ni_peertxcredits > credits)
00224                 ni->ni_peertxcredits = credits;
00225 
00226         if (!tunables->lnd_peercredits_hiw)
00227                 tunables->lnd_peercredits_hiw = peer_credits_hiw;
00228 
00229         if (tunables->lnd_peercredits_hiw < ni->ni_peertxcredits / 2)
00230                 tunables->lnd_peercredits_hiw = ni->ni_peertxcredits / 2;
00231 
00232         if (tunables->lnd_peercredits_hiw >= ni->ni_peertxcredits)
00233                 tunables->lnd_peercredits_hiw = ni->ni_peertxcredits - 1;
00234 
00235         if (tunables->lnd_map_on_demand < 0 ||
00236             tunables->lnd_map_on_demand > IBLND_MAX_RDMA_FRAGS) {
00237                 /* disable map-on-demand */
00238                 tunables->lnd_map_on_demand = 0;
00239         }
00240 
00241         if (tunables->lnd_map_on_demand == 1) {
00242                 /* don't make sense to create map if only one fragment */
00243                 tunables->lnd_map_on_demand = 2;
00244         }
00245 
00246         if (tunables->lnd_concurrent_sends == 0) {
00247                 if (tunables->lnd_map_on_demand > 0 &&
00248                     tunables->lnd_map_on_demand <= IBLND_MAX_RDMA_FRAGS / 8) {
00249                         tunables->lnd_concurrent_sends =
00250                                                 ni->ni_peertxcredits * 2;
00251                 } else {
00252                         tunables->lnd_concurrent_sends = ni->ni_peertxcredits;
00253                 }
00254         }
00255 
00256         if (tunables->lnd_concurrent_sends > ni->ni_peertxcredits * 2)
00257                 tunables->lnd_concurrent_sends = ni->ni_peertxcredits * 2;
00258 
00259         if (tunables->lnd_concurrent_sends < ni->ni_peertxcredits / 2)
00260                 tunables->lnd_concurrent_sends = ni->ni_peertxcredits / 2;
00261 
00262         if (tunables->lnd_concurrent_sends < ni->ni_peertxcredits) {
00263                 CWARN("Concurrent sends %d is lower than message "
00264                       "queue size: %d, performance may drop slightly.\n",
00265                       tunables->lnd_concurrent_sends, ni->ni_peertxcredits);
00266         }
00267 
00268         if (!tunables->lnd_fmr_pool_size)
00269                 tunables->lnd_fmr_pool_size = fmr_pool_size;
00270         if (!tunables->lnd_fmr_flush_trigger)
00271                 tunables->lnd_fmr_flush_trigger = fmr_flush_trigger;
00272         if (!tunables->lnd_fmr_cache)
00273                 tunables->lnd_fmr_cache = fmr_cache;
00274 
00275         return 0;
00276 }
00277 
00278 int
00279 kiblnd_tunables_init(void)
00280 {
00281         default_tunables.lnd_version = 0;
00282         default_tunables.lnd_peercredits_hiw = peer_credits_hiw,
00283         default_tunables.lnd_map_on_demand = map_on_demand;
00284         default_tunables.lnd_concurrent_sends = concurrent_sends;
00285         default_tunables.lnd_fmr_pool_size = fmr_pool_size;
00286         default_tunables.lnd_fmr_flush_trigger = fmr_flush_trigger;
00287         default_tunables.lnd_fmr_cache = fmr_cache;
00288         return 0;
00289 }
